Title: Engineering Data Analyst, Trust and Safety, AI Safety
Description:
Minimum qualifications:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.2 years of experience managing projects and defining project scope, goals, and deliverables.2 years of experience in data science, employing machine learning techniques, identifying trends, and drawing actionable insights from quantitative and qualitative data.Experience with a programming language (e.g., Python or R) and SQL.

Preferred qualifications:

Master’s degree or PhD in a quantitative discipline (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, etc.).5 years of experience in a data analysis or data science setting.Experience in abuse and fraud disciplines, web security, harmful content moderation, and threat analysis.Experience applying machine learning techniques to datasets.Experience with engineering and fine-tuning LLMs.

About The Job

Trust & Safety team members are tasked with identifying and taking on the biggest problems that challenge the safety and integrity of our products. They use technical know-how, excellent problem-solving skills, user insights, and proactive communication to protect users and our partners from abuse across Google products like Search, Maps, Gmail, and Google Ads. On this team, you're a big-picture thinker and strategic team-player with a passion for doing what’s right. You work globally and cross-functionally with Google engineers and product managers to identify and fight abuse and fraud cases at Google speed - with urgency. And you take pride in knowing that every day you are working hard to promote trust in Google and ensuring the highest levels of user safety.

The Trust and Safety AI Safety Protections team safeguards experiences across Google products for all users and enterprise clients. By developing and deploying safety classifiers, both server-side and on-device, the team ensures the distribution of safe and policy-compliant content with a data-driven approach to problem-solving.

At Google we work hard to earn our users’ trust every day. Trust & Safety is Google’s team of abuse fighting and user trust experts working daily to make the internet a safer place. We partner with teams across Google to deliver bold solutions in abuse areas such as malware, spam and account hijacking. A diverse team of Analysts, Policy Specialists, Engineers, and Program Managers, we work to reduce risk and fight abuse across all of Google’s products, protecting our users, advertisers, and publishers across the globe in over 40 languages.

Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Develop scalable safety solutions for AI products across Google by leveraging machine learning and AI techniques.Apply statistical and data science methods to examine Google's protection measures, uncover potential issues, and develop insights for security enhancement.Drive business outcomes by crafting compelling data stories for a variety of stakeholders and senior leadership.Develop automated data pipelines and self-service dashboards to provide insights at scale.Work with sensitive content or situations and possibly graphic, controversial, or upsetting topics or content.

The Opportunity

As our Sr. Analyst, Business Intelligence and Analytics - Competitive Insights, you will be responsible for providing industry knowledge and advanced market analytics to business partners across the Merchandising and other organizations to drive results.

Monitor market trends to uncover patterns or variances between channels and categories. The Central Mobile Analytics team is seeking a senior data analyst to bring their passion for mobile games and data driven cultures to life on new mobile initiatives!

 4+ years of relevant hands on experience, preferably working with large volumes of customer-level data  Strong SQL skills and experience with big data stores (Hive/Hadoop, Big Query, AWS, Snowflake etc)  Experience creating interactive dashboards and easily-understood data visualizations using software (e.g. Tableau, Power BI, Looker)  Understanding of how to best structure and validate A/B tests and experiments  Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and to meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects  Passion to work in a collaborative team environment with multiple customers and competing priorities  Ability to communicate results to a non-technical audience is a must  B.A. or B.S. in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, and/or Engineering Sciences  Experience with live service or mobile games strongly preferred  Preference for familiarity with Python or R  Comfortable presenting findings to an array of audiences, including senior management and non-technical disciplines

Description:

Introduction

At IBM, work is more than a job - it's a calling: To build. To design. To code. To consult. To think along with clients and sell. To make markets. To invent. To collaborate. Not just to do something better, but to attempt things you've never thought possible. Are you ready to lead in this new era of technology and solve some of the world's most challenging problems? If so, lets talk.

Your Role and Responsibilities

As a mid-level Data Analyst, you are responsible for understanding the data flow and ingestion of data involved in the product(s) your team supports. You will interact with government stakeholders and technical team members to gather and document requirements for development, troubleshoot data anomalies and errors, and propose analytic solutions. You will analyze historical data to surface trends and insights using advanced analytical methods, and collaborate with team members to handle cross-team testing dependencies. You are comfortable working side by side with other team members and customers to make decisions together and answer questions about how data is used. You have a passion for detail and are an excellent communicator. You are agile and retrospective, and not afraid to identify what we are doing wrong so we can fix it, and what we are doing right so we can improve upon it.

Must be a US Citizen and able to obtain Public Trust clearance.

Required Technical and Professional Expertise


 Experience collecting, organizing, and analyzing data so that it can be used to accurately report findings to internal and external customers. Experience using Power Apps and Power Automate. Experience working with SQL Queries, Python Scripting, and API configuration. Experience with Jasper, Tableau, or PowerBI. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.


Preferred Technical And Professional Expertise


 2+ years’ experience working in an agile development environment, preferably SAFe or Scrum. Actively participate in and contribute to planning, refinement, estimation, design, retrospective, and technical demo meetings.


About Business Unit

IBM Consulting is IBM’s consulting and global professional services business, with market leading capabilities in business and technology transformation. With deep expertise in many industries, we offer strategy, experience, technology, and operations services to many of the most innovative and valuable companies in the world. Our people are focused on accelerating our clients’ businesses through the power of collaboration. We believe in the power of technology responsibly used to help people, partners and the planet.

Your Life @ IBM

In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.

Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.

Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.

Are you ready to be an IBMer?

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.

IBM offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits program. Eligible employees may have access to: - Healthcare benefits including medical & prescription drug coverage, dental, vision, and mental health & well being - Financial programs such as 401(k), the IBM Employee Stock Purchase Plan, financial counseling, life insurance, short & long- term disability coverage, and opportunities for performance based salary incentive programs - Generous paid time off including 12 holidays, minimum 56 hours sick time, 120 hours vacation, 12 weeks parental bonding leave in accordance with IBM Policy, and other Paid Care Leave programs. IBM also offers paid family leave benefits to eligible employees where required by applicable law - Training and educational resources on our personalized, AI-driven learning platform where IBMers can grow skills and obtain industry-recognized certifications to achieve their career goals - Diverse and inclusive employee resource groups, giving & volunteer opportunities, and discounts on retail products, services & experiences The compensation range and benefits for this position are based on a full-time schedule for a full calendar year.  3+ years of analyzing and interpreting data with Redshift, Oracle, NoSQL etc. experience Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools Experience with data modeling, warehousing and building ETL pipelines Experience in Statistical Analysis packages such as R, SAS and Matlab Experience using SQL to pull data from a database or data warehouse and scripting experience (Python) to process data for modeling

We give you a world of potential

A role you will love

Creating and maintaining Power BI dashboards and reports to track volume collection of work completion, SLAs, timeliness, accuracy, etc…Migrating dashboards and reports from Tableau to Power BICreating and maintaining business intelligence tools to track volume collection of work completion, SLAs, timeliness, accuracy, etc…Works with users to gather business requirements and analytical needs.Identify and recommending potential data sources; compiling and mining data from multiple, cross business sources.Developing specific, customized reports, ad hoc analyses and/or data visualizations.Collaborating with senior analysts and consultants or directly with partners to identify and define business requirements and translating business needs into moderately complex reports and/or recommendations.Briefing solutions to business partners that demonstrate statistical proofs driving recommendations to maximize revenue, minimize cost, increase operational efficiency, and maintain regulatory and organizational compliance.Ensuring adherence to data management/data governance regulations and policies.

With infinite possibilities, we could take you anywhere.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Come join Batch as the first data analyst and work on a team building the future of travel marketplaces.
Description
As a Data Analyst you will play a substantial role in determining Batch’s strategy for growth by uncovering insights in our large amounts of product, marketing and operations data. You will work closely with the CEO, COO, CTO & Head of Marketing to make sure our systems are set up to collect the data we want and then analyze that data to turn it into actionable insights for all teams cross the business.
The ideal candidate will be a balance between strong analytical skills paired with the ability to interpret those data results back into real-world take-aways. They will need to be able to take large datasets and identify the most important ways to slice it by various cohorts and dimensions in order to learn from our user base at a rapid rate. The faster we can uncover hidden truths in our data the faster we can grow and succeed as a company. And this role will be essential for increasing that speed.
Responsibilities include:
Owning the company revenue projection, working with the CEO and COO to understand what drives future growthBuilding company dashboards to track growth levels as well as team-level metricsWorking closely with Marketing team to assess acquisition data and improve marketing tactics based on cohort trendsDigging into areas of data where you see an opportunity for learning, and sharing that learning back with your peers in a strategic wayEnsure we’re choosing the right analytics tools and staying consistent in how we track things across product (mixpanel), marketing (appsflyer & GA) and sales (hubspot)
What we look for:
3+ years in data-focused roles, building analytical infrastructure and data tools. Please include the secret phrase "dataiscool" when applying in the first line of the open text response, so we know you have read and understand the minimum requirements.Stakeholder management experience and an effective way of working with different types of teamsExpertise in SQL - you can translate business questions to queries - along with creation of production data pipelines and familiarity with ETL tools and data warehousesAn eye for Business Impact - the goal of data analysis is to provide tangible direction that can be used by your peers across the company every day, we’re never done looking for ways to improve our product and business!Familiarity with our current data tech stack (BigQuery, Looker, Mixpanel) is preferred.Experience with R or python is a plus.
What is Batch?
Batch is the leading group travel platform to plan a trip with friends and book incredible experiences.
Where is Batch on the startup journey?
Batch is a post-series A startup with >30 employees. We are backed by leading venture capital firms with backgrounds running the largest dating and consumer social apps in history. We are growing fast and successfully just expanded our market from bachelorette parties to all types of parties who want to plan a trip and book fun experiences. We are post-product market fit and figured out our high performance acquisition channels. Now its about being capital efficient while growing exponentially leading into a strong Series B fundraise.
What is the compensation?
We’re allocating $90k for this role with equity. We have healthcare, dental, vision, and 401K benefits. We host an annual retreat where we go to one of our marketplace cities and host a big party. We also have quarterly meetups for members of the leadership team. We have an unlimited vacation policy, wellness stipend, and work from home budget.

Salary
$90,000 - $100,000 per year
